unnormalised: **Home Loan Schemes: What's the deal, ya?**
normalised: Home Loan Schemes: What's the deal, ya?

unnormalised: Okay folks, thinking of finally ditching that rented pigeonhole in Bandra and buying your own sweet home? First of all, *badhai ho*! But the next hurdle is figuring out the home loan schemes available. It's a jungle out there!
normalised: Okay folks, thinking of finally ditching that rented pigeonhole in Bandra and buying your own sweet home? First of all, badhai ho! But the next hurdle is figuring out the home loan schemes available. It's a jungle out there!

unnormalised: So, lemme break it down a little based on what my friend, Priya, went through last year. She was looking at flats in Powai and ended up going with HDFC. They had this "Adjustable Rate Home Loan" that seemed good initially, but remember, interest rates fluctuate! She locked in at 7.8% back in December 2022, but things have changed since then.
normalised: So, let me break it down a little based on what my friend, Priya, went through last year. She was looking at flats in Powai and ended up going with H D F C. They had this "Adjustable Rate Home Loan" that seemed good initially, but remember, interest rates fluctuate! She locked in at seven point eight percent back in December two thousand and twenty two, but things have changed since then.

unnormalised: SBI also has some decent schemes, often targeted towards government employees. Check out their website; they usually have promotional offers around festivals like Diwali (around 23/10/2023 this year, if I remember correctly).
normalised: S B I also has some decent schemes, often targeted towards government employees. Check out their website; they usually have promotional offers around festivals like Diwali (around twenty third October two thousand and twenty three this year, if I remember correctly).

unnormalised: Another thing – don't just look at the interest rate! Processing fees, pre-closure charges, and all that *bakwaas* add up. ICICI Bank, for example, might look attractive initially but read the fine print.
normalised: Another thing – don't just look at the interest rate! Processing fees, pre-closure charges, and all that bakwaas add up. I C I C I Bank, for example, might look attractive initially but read the fine print.

unnormalised: Also, figure out if you're eligible for any subsidies. The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (PMAY) can be a lifesaver if you meet the income criteria. It can knock off a significant chunk.
normalised: Also, figure out if you're eligible for any subsidies. The Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana (P M A Y) can be a lifesaver if you meet the income criteria. It can knock off a significant chunk.

unnormalised: Lastly, shop around! Don't just go with the first bank that gives you *mishti doi*. Talk to different banks, compare their offers (maybe even threaten to go to a competitor – it works sometimes!). Priya finally closed her deal at around 09:30 hrs after much back and forth. Good luck, and remember to read ALL the documents before signing!
